name: Kinnitty Castle Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Just got home from another fab night at kinnitty. The castle seems to have been spruced up an as usual the rooms food and staff were all amazing!!! Can't wait for all our friends and family to have a wonderful experience there at our wedding next jan! :)
reviews.title: Fabulous relaxing night away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: We stayed here 5th January. A long wooded driveway leads to the impressive castle which was nicely decorated for Christmas. We booked through a deal which included an evening meal in the Slí Dala Restaurant, the food and service was really excellent. The checkin staff were very friendly and informative, we upgraded our room, (De La Poer suite) an enormous room with two four-poster double beds and an equally huge bathroom with a free-standing bath in the middle of it, the only minor negative is the damp area in the window side of the ceiling is unsightly. The breakfast the was very good with a wide selection. We will be back here in December for a wedding and are really looking forward to the stay, the great hall looks like a wonderful venue.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable 1 night stay with dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my partner stayed here for our three year annivarsary of our relationship, so I decided to Book this place as part of a deal, I never told him where we would be going, I just popped the destination into the sat Nav and told him to drive, as I wanted the suspense to be greater. We finally arrived On Sat 12th Jan. To his surprise he was amazed where we had gone. (See I told him we would only be going somewhere small and not get to excited). So My surprise to him was this,, The entrance was lovely red carpet candles cannons it was a real authentic castle experience going through the doors and throughout the entire castle.
reviews.title: A Big Surprise Turned Around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: When we checked in all the staff were so nice and polite, we where brought to our room, which we had the Hugh O'Neil Room it was lovely big four poster bed. We had prosecco and chocolates in our room waiting for us, with lovely rose petals as I rang the the before to arrange ( but turned out I booked the following weekend by mistake, but a lovely Lady at reception changed it and told me not to worry) its funny now thinking about it.
reviews.title: One night stay with dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: So my surprise for my partner was totally turned around,,,,,,,
reviews.title: Lovely medieval like experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful grounds and castle but it is definitely haunted!! The staff at this hotel are lovely but although I never believed in hauntings before my stay here-I do now! Try to stay in the new part of the property since when I stayed in the De la pore suite-it was haunted for sure!!!! At first I could not get a good picture of the suite because of all the orbs in the pictures- but I did not know what they were till I got home. We were awoke several times by a ringing phone when I called the front desk to complain --they said it was not possible that our phone rang three separate times from 11-4am without them patching it through? They assured me that they had not transferred a call but that-"maybe I should disconnect the phone so I would not be awoken anymore." I then noticed that the clock radio was disconnected and we heard voices of children running and talking. They said no one was in the rooms around us but it was weird that we heard breathing in our room around 4am and my husband woke me and wanted to leave immediately. He is a fireman 6"2 and 250 lbs who runs into burning buildings for a living but he wanted to get the hell out of there and forego the prepaid breakfast! He told me of hearing voices and how the tv had changed channels several times earlier. Neat place but stay in the new construction part of the building then you might get some sleep- it might be less haunted!!!
reviews.title: Haunted but pretty castle-tough to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful place. This was definately the best part of our vacation. The castle is beautiful. The Staff was friendly and very helpful especially Ciara, who helped make our vacation memoriable with her help. Our room was huge, actually 2 rooms, and was decorated with beautiful furnishings. We enjoyed our walks and were able to see the castle, not just our room. The food was great. The staff in the bar even put the NFL game on TV so we were able to watch a game going on Sunday afternoon in the US. Of the 5 places that we stayed at while in Ireland the Kinnitty Castle was the best! I only wish we stayed there longer. If you are going to Ireland this is the place to stay at least 1 night, we stayed 2. It is definately a castle, very clean, great food, and the staff went way above what we expected. If/when we go back to Ireland the Kinnitty Castle will be a part of our trip. This was the best part of our 8 day trip to Ireland!
reviews.title: 6 Stars! The best part of our vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed here overnight on a voucher that we had been given as a present. It was a lovely drive across the Slieve Bloom Mountains to get to the hotel (Thanks to the Sat nav). The staff were all very friendly, the room was comfortable and warm. The food in the restaurant was delicious and beautifully presented. You could spend all evening just looking at the antiques and all the different areas of the hotel. We went for drinks in the dungeon bar after dinner where there was a friendly barman. Only downside was that our room (Inchquinn) was the first on the hall and as there was a wedding in the hotel the day after we stayed, there were a lot of guests going up and down the hall in the early hours, which were very noisy. Also was on the ground floor so we heard every movement of the guest upstairs but it is a very old building so it was expected. We will definitely be back even if its just for dinner.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, very different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently held our wedding reception at Kinnitty Castle Hotel and we found the whole experience absolutely fantastic - it is a super venue and location and the staff were so helpful. The banquet food was really impressive and all in all it was an experience that we will treasure.
reviews.title: Fantastic venue and experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last weekend for a much needed night away. We were looking forward to checking into a luxurious suite and relaxing for the evening. We were met by friendly receptionist who told us the usual information and then brought us to our room. What a disappointment. We got the Slieve Bloom room. To say it was basic is an understatment. We have stayed in plenty of castles in the past and indeed got maried in one and are well aware that its an old castle not modern resort, but this was by far the most underwhelming of them all. Maybe we just got the worst room. We did ask for another but were told there was nothing available. The bed was tiny, the room was roasting to the point of being really uncomfortable, the tv was basic and the bathroom was very plain. There wasnt even some water in the room which I would consider common practice for a 4 star. My husband went down to the nearest village to get some. We went to the bar after dinner which was full to the brim so no seats or nowhere to stand really. Its a pity they didnt open the Dungeon bar to allow for it. Anyway on the good. The meal we had was absolutely spot on. We really enjoyed every bit of it. Really nice pate, crab, lamb and chicken and plenty of veg with it. The cheese plate for dessert was massive! Hats off to the chef and staff for a lovely meal. Cant fault any of the staff, service was good but would certainly not be going back to that room agan.
reviews.title: disappointing bar the excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We recently stayed 2 nights at Kinnitty Castle as part of our castle tour of Ireland. I was traveling with my brother, and as we drove up to the castle our first night, he said "we're not leaving here alive." The management tries to keep the castle as authentic as possible, so while there are lights and running water, you won't find many other conveniences (no internet, elevators, etc). Our first night there we explored the castle a bit and found a room with nothing identifying it. My brother looked through the keyhole and said he saw a faint glow in the fireplace, as if embers remained from a dying fire, but when I leaned down to look myself, the door moved as though someone has pushed against it from the other side and I couldn't see anything. The receptionist said no one was using that room, but told us stories of the ghost who reportedly lives there. We had a great time there and loved the ghost stories that added to the medieval feeling of the castle. Our bed was small but adequate, and the food was good but nothing too exciting (we only ate breakfast there). If you're looking for a modern hotel with lots of amenities, Kinnitty Castle probably isn't for you, but I would definitely recommend it for the overall experience.
reviews.title: haunted castle?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really imposing hotel property just outside Kinnitty village in an area steeped in history. It has lots of quirky bedrooms and is supposed to have its own ghost although he seemed to be away while we were there. The hotel stands in its own parkland and wooded grounds and I'm sure has produced some stunning wedding photos for people. The building itself has lots of creaks and groans and some poorly fitting windows but these are more than compensated for by the fantastic and homely staff, for whom nothing is too much trouble. Sitting in the library bar with a drink in hand beside the log fire and leafing through the miscellany of old books that line the main wall is a definite pleasure. The food is also top class.
reviews.title: A Castle that feels like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But above all because of the great staff and the fact that the building needs some cosmetic work it feels like home away from home.
reviews.title: Great, but bad food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: Had a lovely night at Kinnitty Castle recently. Lovely grounds and rooms and the service is very good. Surrounded by lovely forest trails in a beautiful part of the country. But, the food was awful. Had pate that wasn't very nice but the melba toast was terrible. It was obviously made earlier or the previous day and kept it the fridge. The mushrooms on brioche was also a stodgy mess and very unappetizing. The little accompaniment with the mains were strange to say the least and didn't belong on the plate. Some strange red cabbage quenelle shape was the worst. Breakfast was also disappointing and tasted like it was cooked an hour earlier rather than to order like it says, but the pastries were fresh and delicious.
reviews.title: Great character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just home from a wedding in kinnitty castle. We stayed 2 nights here and loved it. The staff were all so friendly and accommodating! Food was amazing!! For the ppl who complained about the fox and otter etc what do u expect its a medieval castle and the hotel clearly Is trying to present that throughout the hotel. If that's not what ur looking for then go to a modern chain hotel. Loved the different bedrooms (even if we did get the smallest room out of all our friends :-) the throne toilet really made me laugh. Definitely get your barings before u have a few drinks tho as it has a lot of nooks and crannies and easy to get lost! I say fair play to the staff and management who looked after us all so well! Would definitely recommend this venue to anyone considering having a wedding here. The banquet room was so intimate and romantic!
reviews.title: Beautiful, Quaint, Relaxing Hotel with Top Notch Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kinnitty castle, has that old world charm, some may even say it's a bit quirky but what would you expect 19th century castle in the middle of Ireland!
reviews.title: Good but so easily could have been great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two great nights here, the food was great, the staff lovely, weather wasn't bad either - but why could it have been better.
reviews.title: Disaster - hotel from hell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well the room and the castle was overall cold. Apparently the heating was off during the week in January because the castle was closed and when we arrived Friday evening it was just back on. Dissappointing, especially as an old castle like this would, and did take ages to heat up.
reviews.title: A Great Charming Hotel !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly although the rooms etc were generally clean, attention to detail was missing - cobwebs which should have been removed, excessive dust in the radiators, all the mirrors needed a good clean, ultimately - especially after a close down the rooms should have been spotless but it wasn't the case.
reviews.title: Horrible Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: This has great potential, with attention to detail, more heat and opssibly with some thoughts of leisure facilities, gym, sauna, steam room etc this place would be excellent. Would I go again? Would love too but if the details weren't right the next time - then no!!
reviews.title: Another excellent stay at the charming Kinnitty Castle!

description: Kinnitty Castle, the celebrity haunt, is close to the picturesque village of Kinnitty, Co. Offaly set beautifully against a backdrop of the Slieve Bloom Mountains and is in Ireland's only designated Environment Park. The Castle has a long and turbulent history. Dating originally from 1209, Kinnitty was destroyed and rebuilt not once but twice and yet it retains character and oozes charm. Kinnitty even has its own ghost - a monk, no less! Kinnity is in a great location only 90 minutes from Dublin and is a great stop off point for journeys west or southwards. It is an exceptional place for lovers of good food and the great outdoors.
